page.title: 09THE COLONEL'S VILLAGE
page.content: The streets of the Akroydon / Boothtown areas of Halifax are all named after Cathedral cities. Colonel Edward Akroyd built these two areas, 130 years ago.{He wanted better {housing conditions for his workers. He built 350 houses which are now Square Park. Colonel Akroyd's family had already built Copley a few year's before,{a chapel, a sunday school and {day school.}The Colonel then built All Souls church and his mansion that is now Bankfield Museum. Colonel Akroyd spent hundreds of thousands of pounds on{community {projects}.He spent Â£100,000 on All Souls church.He inherited Â£1,750,000 from his father. Akroyd provided a "life and annuity association" for his workers. In 1857 he was elected MP for Huddersfield.
